plants.name: Lupinus polyphyllus
plants.description: A perennial wildflower and garden favorite with tall spikes covered in pea-like flowers. It thrives in temperate climates and can be found blooming in meadows and along roadsides.
plants.location: Northern Hemisphere, North America and Europe
plants.funFact: Lupines are nitrogen-fixing plants that improve soil fertility by converting atmospheric nitrogen into a usable form.

plants.name: Nicotiana alata
plants.description: An ornamental plant with fragrant tubular flowers that often bloom in summer evenings, attracting pollinators such as moths.
plants.location: Originally from South America, cultivated worldwide in warm temperate to tropical gardens
plants.funFact: Despite its name, flowering tobacco is primarily grown for its attractive, fragrant blossoms and is not used for smoking.

plants.name: Rhododendron ferrugineum
plants.description: A woody shrub found in alpine regions, with bell-shaped flowers that bloom in mid to late summer among rocky mountain slopes.
plants.location: Alpine regions of Europe such as the Alps and Pyrenees
plants.funFact: Alpenrose thrives in acidic, nutrient-poor soils and is an important part of alpine plant communities.

plants.name: Strelitzia reginae
plants.description: Tropical plant famous for its striking, bird-like orange and blue flower structure, symbolizing paradise and exotic beauty.
plants.location: Native to South Africa, cultivated worldwide in warm climates and greenhouses
plants.funFact: The bird of paradise flower is pollinated by sunbirds in its native habitat, attracted to its bright colors and nectar.
